alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 12:01PM PST until January 15 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Navarro River affecting Mendocino County. For the Navarro River...areas along highway 128...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast to begin along portions of Highway 128 Saturday afternoon. * WHERE...Navarro River at Navarro. * WHEN...Warning in effect from noon today through Sunday morning... Flooding to begin impacting areas of highway 128 Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 128 approximately 5 miles east of Highway 1 is certain and the road will be closed. Motorists should use alternate routes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PST Friday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.5 feet late this evening. It will then fall to 17.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 24.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning to 16.1 feet late Sunday evening. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.7 feet on 01/18/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM PST.
